content.body: Yeah, "writing the comparisons `f < a > ()` is a ridiculous thing to do" is a totally reasonable call for a language that's not JS itself.
content.formatted_body: Yeah, "writing the comparisons f < a > () is a ridiculous thing to do" is a totally reasonable call for a language that's not JS itself.

content.body: `>` is just JavaScript's [abjunction operator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Material_nonimplication), so it makes perfectly sense to use it with a boolean expression on its lhs :)
content.formatted_body: > is just JavaScript's abjunction operator, so it makes perfectly sense to use it with a boolean expression on its lhs :)
